Articles.Content: So I've been gearing up for the upcoming Duna missions.  However, the engine I am using for my 1st stage is a griffon from kw rocketry. Unfortunately.  I cannot get it to orbit as it overheats before burning off hardly any fuel. I've loaded this thing with radiators and it helped a bit. But I'm sick and tired of it and wish to change the engine overheat temp. How do I change that?

There is a field in the config file called maxTemp = x, where x is the temperature in kelvin.

However, this should not be necessary if you have the KW Rocketry Community Fixes installed. Consider grabbing that.
Mind linking it? I changed the temp from 3000k to 10000k and it still overheats

4 hours ago, Yuri kagarin56 said:

Mind linking it? I changed the temp from 3000k to 10000k and it still overheats

I expect that this is what you want:

https://spacedock.info/mod/51/KW%20Rocketry%20-%20Community%20Fixes

 

On a general note... any time you find yourself wanting to "edit" the value of any parameters of a part (stock or otherwise)... you can do that by directly editing the config file, but that's typically not a great solution because it's not very maintainable (any time you upgrade to a new version, it'll wipe your changes).  A better way is to use a snippet of ModuleManager config to make the change-- that way it's added as a "patch" on top of whatever-is-currently-installed.  See documentation on the ModuleManager thread for syntax details.
